document.masterDocTitle: New species, new combinations and synonymies of Neotropical Galerucini (Coleoptera, Chrysomelidae, Galerucinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
I examined the type-material and other specimens identified by Bechyné as
Caraguata paraensis
Bechyné & Bechyné, 1961
(subsequently transferred to
Metrogaleruca
as a subspecies of
M. obscura
) and I verified that they bear the same characteristics as
Metrogaleruca obscura obscura
. Because I have a large series of specimens of
Metrogaleruca obscura
(
Fig. 8
), it is possible to report variability in the size of the color pattern, even in specimens from the same locality. Therefore, the division of
Metrogaleruca obscura
into two subspecies is not justified.

As for
Metrogaleruca longula
(originally described by Bechyné in
Caraguata
and here synonymized with
M. obscura
),
Bechyné ( 1963 )
distinguished
Caraguata longula diminuta
only because of its smaller size and the presence of a darker area at each side of the thoracic disc; these characteristics are also observed in the examined specimens of
M. obscura
and constitute merely intraspecific variation within populations.

Examined material. VENEZUELA , Falcon : Chichiriviche, 2 ♀,
29 .II. 1964
, J. & B. Bechyné col. ( MIZA ). SURINAME , Paramaribo : Paramaribo (l’Hermitage)(at light), ♂,
